Q4 FY25 (March 2025 Quarter) Results:Fluorochem reported an 8% year-on-year revenue increase, driven by the Fluoropolymers segment. EBITDA grew by 28%, and net debt decreased.

Segment Performance:The Fluoropolymer segment showed strong growth, and the Battery Materials business was expected to grow with planned expansions.

Capacity Expansion:The company was expanding capacity in Battery Chemicals and Fluoropolymers, with significant investments planned for FY26, including INR 12 billion for battery chemicals and AHF, and INR 4 billion for ref-gas and fluoropolymers.

New Product Focus:Fluorochem was preparing to produce Lithium Iron Phosphate (LFP) and investing in monomer capacity for fluoropolymers.

Cautiously Optimistic Sentiment:Market sentiment was cautiously optimistic due to improved pricing and inventory management.

Growth Projections:The company projected 25% growth in the Fluoropolymer segment.

Working Capital Reduction:Management focused on reducing working capital.

Shift Towards Renewables:A shift towards renewable energy was expected to reduce power and fuel costs.
